meanings.definition: To move in a secret or sneaky manner.
meanings.sent1: She snuck quietly past the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent2: He snuck out of the house without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat snuck up on the unsuspecting bird.
meanings.sent4: The shadows snuck across the room as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: The spy snuck through the dark alley, avoiding detection.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she snuck into the kitchen to grab a cookie.
meanings.sent2: He snuck a peek at the surprise party decorations.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon snuck into the trash can for a late-night snack.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood snuck into her mind unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The secret message was snuck into his pocket without him noticing.
